page.title: 06Farming.
page.content: It is a mixed farming area with farms between 200 and 350 acres each.The mainly dairy farms have friesian cows with Hereford bulls.Besides the milking stock they also have young stock or beef stock. They have few or no other livestock.They also grow winter and spring barley, wheat, ley for silage, maize and kale. The mainly arable farms also keep sheep and some beef cattle.Winter and spring wheat and barley are the main crops.Suger beet in the main root crop but some swedes are grown.Oil seed rape is becoming a more popular crop with bright yellow fields in the spring and early summer.Breeding ewes and lambs, and store lambs are fattened on beet pulp and silage.
